subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: {{ja-etym-kokuji}},<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> using the {{m|ja|魚}} radical on the left for its meaning of “fish”, and {{m|ja|念}} on the right for its [[phonetic]] value as a homophone of {{m|ja|粘|tr=nen||sticky; slimy}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{swp|lang=ja}} [[File:Naturalis_Biodiversity_Center_-_RMNH.ART.134_-_Silurus_asotus_(Linnaeus)_-_Kawahara_Keiga_-_1823_-_1829_-_Siebold_Collection_-_pencil_drawing_-_water_colour.jpeg|thumb|250px|鯰 (''namazu''): a biologist's depiction of a {{vern|Amur catfish}} ({{vern|Japanese catfish}}).]]
{{ja-kanjitab|なまず|yomi=k}} Possibly from {{com|ja|sort=なまず|滑|tr1=nama|t1=slippery, slimy|pos1=possible ancient alternate for ''name'' reading|頭|tr2=zu|t2=head}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|なまず|ナマズ|hhira=なまづ}}

# an {{vern|Amur catfish}} ({{taxlink|Silurus asotus|species|noshow=1}})
